::FZ/Galactors::

FZ and the Galactors enter the bridge of the Iron Fist. The Galactors 
were familiar with the layout of the great warship; it was programmed 
into their datatracks. FZ frowns, looking at the scanners and seeing 
the battle at the CF. Hell Beast was heading toward it. Zardus had 
wanted peaceful relations with the Maximals. Helping them in a battle 
was a good way of achieving that.

"Supernova, take your troops and go to the Maximal base. Once you 
arrive, tell them you come in peace and attack any Predacon you see. 
If some Predacons have this energy signature," he points to a scanner 
report on the Black Fortress, showing the energy signature of 
Darkfate's group, "Then leave them alone. Otherwise they die."

Supernova nods at his instructions. "The Predacons will die, have no 
doubt," he assures FZ and turns around, walking out of the bridge and 
outof  the IF, the others following him.

"Galactors, form jets," he says and jumps into the air, the other 
Galactors doing the same. Several seconds later two jets were formed 
from the five Galactors, one of them bigger than the other since it 
consisted of three bots while the other one was made of two. The 
bigger jet was yellow, orange, and white. It consisted of Supernova, 
Flare, and Scrap. The first jet's weapons consisted of heavy 
explosives, and it had a rather advanced repair system. The second 
jet was gray, consisting of Vycir and Slasys. It shimmered, becoming 
invisible as Vycir's cloaking system activated. The second jet had 
heavy plasma and laser weapons.

Both jets activate their engines, flying off at high speed toward the 
Cybertronian Fire.






--- In nbwrpg@y..., JP3884@a... wrote:
>        Hell Beast emerged, followed by Marine, Inferno, and 
Rampage. The 
> others were en route to the new base where Shockwave was going to 
set them 
> up. In the meantime, The brotherhood was attacking the Cybertronian 
Fire and 
> Hell Beast was prepared to help.
>        "Predacons attack!" He yelled the battle cry and the 
foursome burst 
> into action. The CF was going to be under heavy fire very soon.
